content: Rui (Zoey) HuSearch this siteEmbedded FilesSkip to main contentSkip to navigationRui (Zoey) HuAssistant Professor of Computer Science & EngineeringUniversity of Nevada, RenoAbout MeI am Rui (Zoey) Hu, an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science & Engineering at University of Nevada, Reno. My research mainly focuses on solving the security, privacy, and efficiency issues of machine learning, federated learning, large language model, edge computing, etc..I am currently looking for highly self-motivated Ph.D. students in Fall 2026 (with assistantship) who are interested in working on multi-modal model fine-tuning, federated learning, agentic AI, reinforcement learning, efficient AI, or AI security. Please send me your CV, transcripts, TOEFL and GRE scores, and everything else that you believe will help your application if you are interested. [I will only be able to respond to applications that are of interest, given the number received.][updated-Jul. 2025] For current undergraduate and graduate students at UNR who are interested in LLM security topics such as prompt injection and would like to gain project or research experience, feel free to email me or stop by my office. If you are interested in AI security more broadly, I highly recommend taking my course, CS 791 CyberAI, which is offered during the spring semester.[Nov. 2025] Looking for undergraduate students at UNR who is interested in doing projects on building up agentic AI for robotics.
